title: Anti-Inflammatory Quinoa Breakfast Bowl
instructions: Rinse quinoa thoroughly and cook in coconut milk with ginger and salt for 15 minutes
Stir in vanilla and coconut oil
Top with fresh blueberries, pear slices, and pumpkin seeds
Serve warm or at room temperature
notes: Fresh ingredients only - avoid frozen berries which can be higher in histamines
author: Dr. Sarah Nutrition

title: Fresh Zucchini Pasta with Herbs
instructions: Heat olive oil in large pan over medium heat
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until just tender
Remove from heat and add fresh herbs, pine nuts, and lemon juice
Season with salt and pepper
Serve immediately while warm
notes: Use fresh herbs only - dried herbs can trigger histamine reactions
author: Chef Maria

title: Mild Coconut Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat coconut oil in large pot over medium-high heat
Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned
Add turmeric and cumin, stir for 1 minute
Pour in coconut milk and bring to gentle simmer
Add vegetables and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice
notes: Fresh chicken only - avoid pre-marinated or processed chicken
author: Chef Anna

title: Fresh Apple & Rice Crackers
instructions: Slice apples into thin wedges
Mix sunflower seed butter with coconut oil until smooth
Spread mixture on rice crackers
Top with fresh apple slices
Sprinkle with sea salt if desired
notes: Use fresh apples only - avoid stored apples which may be higher in histamines
author: Nutritionist Emma

title: Roasted Sweet Potato & Ginger Soup
ingredients: 4 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F. Toss sweet potatoes with 2 tbsp coconut oil
Roast sweet potatoes for 25-30 minutes until tender
In large pot, heat remaining coconut oil over medium heat
Add onion and ginger, cook until softened
Add roasted sweet potatoes, broth, and turmeric
Simmer for 10 minutes, then blend until smooth
Stir in coconut milk, season with salt and pepper
Garnish with fresh cilantro
notes: Perfect for meal prep - stores well in refrigerator for up to 4 days
author: Wellness Coach Lisa
